alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Fayette Ridges; Greene (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 31 at 7:18PM EST until January 04 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM EST SATURDAY THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following areas, Fayette, Greene and Higher Elevations of Fayette. * WHEN...From 1 AM EST Saturday through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall of 1.5 to 2.0 inches is possible, with heavy rain rates expected Saturday afternoon. Isolated areas may see more than 2 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
